text: [Music]
hi guys it's angel today I'm going to

bird's nest which is a Chinese delicacy

years now in mandarin swallow bird's
nest is pronounced as yin wool and it's
literally known as caviar of the east
because it's not only rare and expensive
but it's also a delicacy as an herb
bird's nest is known to boost the immune
system and it's also good for the lungs
skin hair and nails and according to

bird's nest and if you haven't seen

from the birds saliva and slightly

in today's video I've partnered with
golden nest geniune wall to use their
new simply swift swallow bird's nest

and with that I'm going to show you guys
how to make solo bird's nest as an

say guys let's get kicking the first
drink I'm making is swallow bird's nest
with dates and goji berries for the
ingredients we'll need six pieces of
dried goji berries two to three pieces
of dried red dates and I've gone ahead
to soak mine for an hour or so to soften
at first and then slice into halves
and for a little sweetness a little rock
sugar to taste I recommend starting out
with half a tablespoon to start to cook
bring two cups of filtered water to a
boil and once it's boiled add one piece
of simply Swift bird's nest then the
dates and goji berries then cover and
boil on medium heat for 15 minutes after
15 minutes turn off the heat add your
rock sugar and gently stir to dissolve
when it's done cooking pour into your
glass containers and let cool before
refrigerating and to store these drinks
I'm using these really cute glass jars
that I got with these cork lids
[Music]
the next drink I'm making is swallow
bird's nest with Jen singing
chrysanthemum flowers for the
ingredients we'll need six dry
chrysanthemum flower buds and five
slices of american Genting Group and if
you end up getting the whole jensine
root you can always ask your local

super easy to make just bring two cups
of filtered water to a boil add 1 piece

and boil on medium heat for 15 minutes
after 15 minutes turn off the heat and
add the ginseng root and chrysanthemum

we'll let the pots it covered for 15

finally for drinks number three I'm
making a desert swallow bird's nest with
poached Asian pear and coconut milk for
this recipe we'll need half a small size
Asian pear peel and cut a quarter of the
pear into small bite-sized pieces then
cut another quarter of the pear to use
for infusing the liquid with flavors
like before we'll bring two cups of
filtered water to a boil then add one
piece of simply Swift bird's nests and
the larger pear pieces then cover and
boil on medium heat for 15 minutes
halfway through the cook time is when
we'll add the smaller bite-sized pear
pieces after it's done cooking turn off
the heat add rock sugar to taste and
gently stir to dissolve here we'll want
to remove the larger pear pieces leaving
the smaller bite-sized pear pieces for
the drink then pour into your glass
containers leaving a bit of room for the

chilled and ready to serve top it off
with a little bit of coconut milk to
taste
